alert.note: Alert for Chuckwalla Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 3:34PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Riverside County through 415 PM PDT... At 334 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Nicholls Warm Springs, or 31 miles east of Desert Center. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Riverside County. This includes CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 135 and 141. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
